adjective.description: Existing only in theory or as a suggestion or idea.
examples: notional budgets for hospital and community health services

adjective.description: Denoting or relating to an approach to grammar that is dependent on the definition of terminology (e.g., “a verb is an action word”) as opposed to identification of structures and processes.
(in language teaching) denoting or relating to a syllabus that aims to develop communicative competence.

origin: Late Middle English (in the Latin sense): from obsolete French, or from medieval Latin notionalis relating to an idea, from notio(n-) idea (see notion).
